=== Kubuntu 12.04 LTS ===

The Kubuntu team is proposing that the Kubuntu 12.04 release be supported for 5 years as an LTS release.

=== Considerations ===

* '''Ubuntu Desktop LTS Support Cycle'''
** The Ubuntu Desktop support cycle is for 12.04 to be supported for 5 years.  Kubuntu has a history of following the Ubuntu Desktop LTS support cycles (except for 08.04) and Canonical's customers will continue to expect this.
* '''Upstream Qt and KDE support cycles'''
** This is a good time for an LTS.  Qt is working on Qt 5 which will be shipped later in 2012 and KDE is working on KDE Frameworks 5 which will be shipped after Qt 5.  So Qt 4 and KDE Frameworks 4 are both mature and stable products which will be suitable for supporting for 5 years.

=== Point Releases ===

* Kubuntu will be following the point releases with Ubuntu:
** https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PrecisePangolin/ReleaseSchedule
** Kubuntu 12.04.1: 18 October 2012
** Kubuntu 12.04.2: 31 January 2013
** Kubuntu 12.04.3: 15 August 2013
** Kubuntu 12.04.4: 24 January 2014
* We have Kubuntu members who are willing to test this releases

=== Support Plan ===

~kubuntu-dev and ~kubuntu-members will be the supporters of Kubuntu 12.04 as an LTS.

JonathanRiddell works for Canonical and will be responsive to support requests for Canonical.  AurelienGateau will be emergency backup.

KDE has active security updates from upstream.

Qt has active security updates from upstream.

Kubuntu security updates are handled by either Kubuntu or Ubuntu Security team as currently.

The Kubuntu team has a history of successfully updating KDE SC releases, for example 4.7.3 in oneiric.  They go through a rigorous QA process which involves testing in a PPA, testing in -proposed and finally moving to -updates.  This includes KDE SC translation packages.  This is expected to be kept for the 12.04 LTS.

As a team we have a successful history of updating Kubuntu packages for notable bugfixes, examples in oneiric:
* https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/oneiric-changes/2011-November/011405.html konversation
* https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/oneiric-changes/2011-November/011403.html libmsn

=== Release Status ===

12.04 is currently in development.  There is an active discussion about whether we will release 1.5GB image but this involves taking software away from our current DVDs rather than adding it.

We will consider KDE-telepathy to replace Kopete, but only include it if it works reliably and upstream can commit to supporting it.

We expect to release a Kubuntu Active image for tablets and mobile, we will not include this in an support plan and will have the necessary software in universe.

=== Tech Board Requirements ===

Align with Ubuntu LTS release cycle.

* Must have a proven track record of participating in at least 2 non-LTS releases before applying to TechnicalBoard for LTS designation.
** We have been part of the Ubuntu releases since Hoary
* Flavor's support plan presented to Tech Board and approved; support plan should indicate period of time if Beyond 18months (3yrs or 5yr), key contacts, and setting expectations as to level of support. Support plan public and ongoing support contacts accessible for discussion of bugs and security issues (or alternates designated) through life of project.
** See above
* Key Upstream packages worth supporting for extended cycle.
** In our seeds: kubuntu-common, desktop, dvd, live, ship, ship-live, supported, supported-desktop-extra
* Written confirmation from IS that space and resources are available to retain images in archive through LTS life cycle. 
** Ask them but it hasn't been an issue thus far

=== Sabdfl KubuntuLtsRequirements ====

<nowiki>[[KubuntuLtsRequirements]]</nowiki> lists Sabdfl's requirements from 2010.

* '''Category Indicators'''
** '''Messaging Menu'''
** This is present and installed and used by default
** '''Sound Menu'''
** Unfortunately nobody had time to work on this in Kubuntu or DX team.  It has been reviewed by upstream and considered a desirable feature.
* '''Application Indicators'''
** These were developed by KDE where it is called KStatusNotifierItem.  KDE and Qt applications work on Ubuntu and Ubuntu applications work on Kubuntu.
* '''Global Menu'''
** Present and used by default in the netbook setup.  Supported upstream in Qt now.
* '''Notify-OSD Support'''
** Supported upstream now, applications handle the notify-osd by correctly by default.  There is also a Colibri plasma notifier which immitates the behaviour of the Ubuntu desktop one.

=== Tech Board Questions ===

From the tech board meeting about Edubuntu 
* how many developers does the Kubuntu team have
** 7 active members in https://launchpad.net/~kubuntu-dev/+members plus agateau
